entry.title: Vitalik: Worldcoin has been taking privacy criticisms seriously, designing their system to require less and less data.
entry.summary: On March 29, Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, responded to a tweet regarding the "Worldcoin project data collection" on social media platform BlockBeats, stating, "In my view, Worldcoin has been taking privacy criticisms seriously and designing their system to become less reliant on data. Modern cryptography is truly amazing."

entry.title: Binance executive who was detained has filed a lawsuit against Nigerian authorities.
entry.summary: According to BlockBeats news on March 29th, Binance executive Tigran Gambaryan, who was previously detained, has filed a lawsuit against the National Security Advisor (NSA) and the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) of Nigeria, alleging infringement of his personal rights and seeking five major reliefs from the court. His lawyer argued on the grounds of human rights that the detention of his international passport violated the constitution and infringed on his personal freedom, and urged the court to return his passport and release him immediately after more than three weeks. In addition, he also requested the court to issue an injunction prohibiting future detention in similar investigations and demanded public apologies from the National Security Advisor and the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission.

entry.title: Fjord Foundry will issue FJO tokens and airdrop them on March 22nd.
entry.summary:
According to an official announcement from the LBP platform Fjord Foundry on March 29th, they will issue their native token FJO through LBP. The LBP date will be from 11:00 pm on April 16th to 11:00 pm on April 18th, with a supply of 7.5% of the total supply, which is 7.5 million tokens.
The total supply of FJO is 100 million tokens, with an initial starting supply of approximately 15%, with roughly half of that coming from the Fjord LBP event. After six months, the supply will reach approximately 30%. 4% of the total supply will be distributed to the community via airdrop, over a period of three months. The airdrop snapshot was taken on March 22nd.
- 1.5% of the airdrop will be given to Copper Launch and V1 users of Fjord Foundry. - 2.5% of the airdrop will be given to V2 users of Fjord Foundry.
The maximum number of FJO tokens that a wallet can hold theoretically is 1,275 tokens. These tokens will be available for collection within six months after TGE.

entry.title: Cathie Wood: Selling Coinbase stock is not "dumping", but portfolio management.
entry.summary:
According to BlockBeats news on March 29th, Cathie Wood, CEO of Ark Invest, explained the reason behind selling Coinbase (COIN) stock. During an AMA on Thursday, a user asked why Ark Invest was "selling" its Coinbase shares. Wood responded, "We are not selling. This is the whole point of active management."
Wood stated that "since the spring of 2023, Coinbase's value has increased by about 9 times. It has exceeded 10% of the portfolio. We are just taking profits. It is still our largest holding and we are reinvesting these profits in stocks like Coinbase a year ago, as well as stocks in the short-term news-affected areas such as Tesla and many life sciences."
Prior to the Q&A session on March 26th, Ark Invest sold 74,291 shares of Coinbase stock worth $20.8 million as Coinbase's stock price rose by 10%. A month ago, the company sold 96,435 shares of COIN stock for $16 million.

entry.title: Bitwise has submitted an application for a physically-backed Ethereum ETF to the U.S. SEC.
entry.summary:
BlockBeats reported on March 29th that Bitwise has submitted an application for a spot Ethereum ETF to the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
Earlier this month, Matt Hougan, Chief Information Officer of Bitwise, stated that approval for a spot Ethereum ETF would be best obtained after May.

entry.title: The United States and the United Kingdom are investigating a $20 billion cryptocurrency transaction related to illegal Russian sanctions.
entry.summary:
According to a report from Bloomberg on March 29th, the United States and the United Kingdom are reviewing over $20 billion worth of cryptocurrency transactions conducted through a Russian virtual trading platform. Sources say that the payments under review were made using the USD-pegged cryptocurrency Tether (USDT) through Garantex, a Moscow-based cryptocurrency trading platform.
It is reported that the United States and the United Kingdom imposed sanctions on Garantex in April 2022, on suspicion of aiding money laundering, terrorist financing, and ransomware attacks. This $20 billion transaction would be one of the most serious violations since the sanctions began.

entry.title: SBF has been sentenced to 25 years in prison in New York for multi-billion dollar fraud.
entry.summary:
BlockBeats news, on March 28th, according to Reuters, SBF was sentenced to 25 years in prison in New York for a multi-billion dollar fraud.
In the final trial of the SBF case, Judge Kaplan said, "I know the government (prosecutors) recommended a sentence of 40 to 50 years, which is unnecessary. But SBF clearly has no remorse. I want to add one thing. I don't think it's effective to spend time clarifying every lie. When he's not lying, he's evasive and anxious, trying to get the prosecutor to rephrase the question for him. I've been in this job for nearly 30 years and have never seen such a performance." The court sentenced SBF to a total of 300 months in prison (25 years).

entry.title: Yesterday, the net inflow of the US Bitcoin spot ETF was approximately $254 million.
entry.summary:
According to data from @HODL15Capital, on March 28th, BlockBeats reported that the net inflow of the US Bitcoin spot ETF was approximately 254 million US dollars.
BlackRock IBIT had a net inflow of 324 million US dollars, ARKB had a net inflow of 201.8 million US dollars, and Grayscale GBTC had a net outflow of 299.8 million US dollars.

entry.title: Linae has launched the Linea Surge event for another 6 months, where participants can interact and earn SBT LXP-L.
entry.summary:
BlockBeats news, on March 28th, according to official sources, Ethereum Layer 2 network Linea announced that it will launch The Linea Voyage: Surge event, which will begin in April and last for six months or until the network's TVL reaches 3 billion US dollars.
The official statement said that Linea Surge will enhance its ecosystem by bringing liquidity (TVL) to the network and gamifying asset strategic deployment in its safest DeFi protocols. Liquidity managers will be able to collect a non-transferable soul-bound token (SBT) LXP-L while participating in their favorite DeFi protocols. LXP-L is carefully designed to track liquidity on Linea. It will be collected regularly and use point-based multipliers relevant to vertical use cases and asset categories, which will change over time to ensure the healthy development of the Linea ecosystem.

entry.title: The likelihood of GSR's Ethereum spot ETF being approved in May has been downgraded to 20%.
entry.summary:
According to a report by The Block on March 28th, Brian Rudick, an analyst at market maker GSR, stated in a report on Wednesday that he believes there is a 20% chance that the SEC will approve a spot Ethereum ETF in May this year, which is a significant decrease from GSR's prediction of a 75% chance in January.
The analyst stated that the US Securities and Exchange Commission is under some political pressure not to approve more digital asset ETFs. The SEC's investigation into whether Ethereum is a security could greatly reduce the likelihood of approval. Regulatory agencies may seek to avoid turning the potential approval of an Ethereum spot ETF into "another big event".
Regarding future expectations, the analyst believes that any approval process for a spot Ethereum ETF may take longer and may be affected by litigation. He now believes that the most likely approval time for an Ethereum spot ETF is between 2025 and 2026.

entry.title: NFT card game Parallel completes $35 million in financing, with participation from Solana Ventures and others.
entry.summary: According to BlockBeats news on March 28th, the sci-fi themed NFT card game Parallel has completed a $35 million financing round. The round was participated in by Solana Ventures, Distributed Global, OSS Capital, VanEck, Focus Labs, Big Brain Holdings, Base, Collab+Currency, Amber Group, Spartan Group, and Builder Capital.

entry.title: Yesterday, ARKB recorded a historic net inflow of $201.8 million, and the overall net inflow of ETFs for the day has been confirmed.
entry.summary:
According to data from Farside Investors, ARK Invest's ARKB had a net inflow of $201.8 million on March 28, setting a new record for the ETF's highest single-day net inflow.
Based on the latest data, Grayscale's GBTC had a net outflow of $299 million yesterday, while the overall net inflow of 6 Bitcoin spot ETFs, including BlackRock's IBIT and Fidelity's FBTC, exceeded $94 million, confirming the net inflow situation of ETFs as a whole yesterday.

entry.title: Ethena will airdrop 750 million ENA tokens on April 2nd and list on CEX.
entry.summary:
According to official sources, Ethena announced that it will launch the ENA airdrop and go live on CEX on April 2. Any user who cancels the pledge, unlocks, or sells all USDe before this date will not be eligible for the airdrop, except for Pendle YT holders. The total amount of the airdrop is 750 million tokens (5% of the total supply), which can be claimed for a maximum of 30 days. Any unclaimed ENA will be redistributed to second-season users after this period.
Over 90,000 user addresses are eligible for the airdrop, and the top 2,000 users in the points ranking and YT token holders of Pendle will initially unlock only 50%, with the remaining 50% being unlocked linearly within 6 months. In addition, 3% of the total supply (0.15% of the total supply) will be distributed to SchizoPosters and Redacted Remilio Babies NFT holders.
The total supply of Ethena (ENA) tokens is 15 billion, with an initial circulating supply of 1.425 billion. Core contributors and investors will be allocated 30% (locked for 1 year), ecosystem economic development will be allocated 25%, and the Ethena Foundation will be allocated 15%. ENA will be used to vote on governance proposals related to the Ethena protocol.
The Ethena Shard event will end on April 1, lasting only 6 weeks, making it one of the shortest pre-token events in the crypto field. The supply of USDe has increased to over 1.3 billion US dollars, making it the fastest stablecoin to surpass a supply of 1 billion US dollars. It is also the highest-earning protocol in the industry, with a 7-day revenue of 8 million US dollars, surpassing MakerDAO's 4.8 million. Ethena Sats (season 2) will start immediately after season 1 ends, supporting BTC as the underlying asset. The Sats event will last for 5 months or until the supply of USDe reaches 5 billion US dollars.

entry.title: Fed's bellwether Bullard: Not in a hurry to cut interest rates, should cut rates later or less.
entry.summary:
BlockBeats news on March 28th: As a member of the Federal Reserve who serves as a recent barometer of the Fed's policy, Bullard said that there is currently no urgent need to cut interest rates. He emphasized that recent disappointing inflation data suggests that this year's interest rate cuts may be delayed or reduced. Bullard said he hopes to see "at least a few months of improved inflation data" before cutting interest rates.
He pointed out that strong economic and employment conditions are further reasons for the Fed to wait. In a prepared speech at the New York Economic Club on Wednesday, Bullard said, "In my view, based on recent data, it is appropriate to reduce the total number of interest rate cuts or postpone them to the future. I believe that economic output and the labor market continue to show sustained strength, while progress in reducing inflation has slowed. Given these signs, I think it is not necessary to rush to take steps to relax monetary policy." Bullard used the phrase "no rush" four times in his speech, including in the title of his prepared remarks. (Jin10)

entry.title: Huang Licheng launched the Meme project Bobaoppa on Solana, with current fundraising exceeding 120,000 SOL.
entry.summary:
BlockBeats reported on March 28th that Huang Licheng, the "Big Brother Ma Ji" announced the launch of the Meme project Bobaoppa on Solana and started fundraising, with a minimum fundraising amount of 1 SOL. According to the disclosed fundraising address information, the current amount raised has reached 120,522.73 SOL, worth approximately 21,920,674.39 US dollars.
BlockBeats reminds users that Meme coin has significant volatility, and they should invest cautiously and pay attention to asset security.

entry.title: Bitcoin Layer 2 network BOB has completed a $10 million seed round of financing, led by Castle Island Ventures.
entry.summary:
BlockBeats News, on March 28th, BOB (short for "Build on Bitcoin"), the first Bitcoin layer 2 network compatible with the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) standard, has completed a $10 million seed round of financing. Castle Island Ventures led this round of financing, with participation from Mechanism Ventures, Bankless Ventures, CMS Ventures, and UTXO Management. Angel investors include Dan Held and Domo, the creator of the BRC-20 token standard.
As a hybrid layer 2 network, BOB not only sits on top of the Bitcoin blockchain but also has compatibility with Ethereum.

entry.title: Bitcoin Lightning Network company Neutronpay has completed a $1.5 million bridge financing round, led by Axiom Capital.
entry.summary:
BlockBeats reported on March 27th that Neutronpay, a Bitcoin Lightning Network company, announced the completion of a $1.5 million bridge financing round led by Axiom Capital. The financing aims to help Neutronpay provide instant and cost-effective payment solutions using Bitcoin in Southeast Asia's digital economy.
As previously reported by BlockBeats, in September 2022, Neutronpa completed a $2.25 million seed funding round led by Hivemind Ventures, with participation from Republic, Cavalry, Ride Wave, Studio, Iterative, Fulgur Ventures, Lightning Labs, and individual investors Bill Crowley and Lisa Shields.

entry.title: Founder of Blast: Former Munchables developers have chosen to return funds, hoping that Blast developers can learn from their mistakes.
entry.summary: BlockBeats news, on March 27th, Pacman, the founder of Blast, posted on social media that Blast core contributors had obtained $97 million in funds through multi-signature. Thanks to the former Munchables developers for choosing to return all funds without any ransom. Munchables and protocols integrated with it, such as Juice finance, were affected in this incident. It is important for all development teams, whether directly affected or not, to learn from this and take preventive measures to ensure security more thoroughly. Core contributors are always happy to help Blast builders and audit partners establish contact. At the same time, we are working hard to support the Munchables team in safely distributing funds to users. More detailed information will be shared later this week.

entry.title: Vitalik: The definition of the metaverse is still ambiguous and requires a combination of cryptocurrency, virtual reality, and AI.
entry.summary: According to BlockBeats news on March 27th, Coindesk reported that Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, stated at the BUIDL Asia conference in Seoul that "the definition of the metaverse is unclear and is often seen more as a category name than a product. It is envisioned as a virtual world that everyone can participate in and does not belong to anyone. It is often associated with virtual reality, but the demand for virtual reality is simpler, like wanting a laptop without a notebook. In order for this virtual world to work properly, we need to combine all the different virtual world elements we already have, including cryptocurrencies, virtual reality, and some artificial intelligence components, in the right way."

entry.title: The developers of Munchables have agreed to unconditionally share all Munchables funding keys.
entry.summary: BlockBeats reported on March 27th that Munchables officials announced on social media that the developers had agreed to unconditionally share all Munchables fund keys. Earlier today, the Blast ecosystem project Munchables was attacked, resulting in the theft of 17,400 ETH (approximately $62.3 million). According to investigations by blockchain detective ZachXBT, the theft was due to one of Munchables' developers being a North Korean hacker. Further investigation revealed that four different developers hired by the team were linked to the attacker, and it is likely that they are the same person.

entry.title: Decrypt's official email account has been hacked and emails containing phishing links have been distributed to subscribers.
entry.summary: BlockBeats reported on March 27th that Decrypt, a cryptocurrency media outlet, announced on social media that its email communication account had been hacked and phishing scam emails had been sent to all subscribers. Users are advised to delete the email and not open or click on any links. There is no DECRYPT airdrop activity and the official team is working to regain access.

entry.title: ZachXBT: Four developers hired by the Munchables team are linked to the attacker, possibly one person playing four roles.
entry.summary: BlockBeats news on March 27th, blockchain investigator ZachXBT posted on social media that four different developers hired by the Munchables team have connections to the attacker and are likely the same person. They recommended each other for the job and regularly transferred payments to the same two deposit addresses on the exchange platform. The wallets of the "four individuals" showed transactions between each other.

entry.title: Musk replies to the creator of the word "meme" in a tweet, and DAW rises more than 24% in 24 hours.
entry.summary:
BlockBeats news, on March 27th, Richard Dawkins, a well-known evolutionary biologist, animal behaviorist, and science writer in the UK, posted on social media saying, "Oh, that's interesting. To commemorate my birthday on March 26th and the creation of the word 'meme' in 1976, someone created a 'Dawkoin' meme coin. I don't even know what that means, but it sounds fun."
Elon Musk later replied to the tweet with a "laughing until crying" emoji.
According to market data, the Solana-based meme coin Dawkoins (DAW) is currently priced at $0.0018 with a 24-hour increase of 24.61%.

entry.title: 10x Research plans to launch a portfolio model for investing in altcoins, seeking to achieve a 10x return within 6 to 12 months.
entry.summary:
BlockBeats reported on March 27th that 10x Research will launch a portfolio model for investing in altcoins, aiming to hold positions that can generate 10 times returns within 6 to 12 months.
10x Research will continuously update positions based on fundamental factors such as network usage, total value locked (TVL), and revenue trends, with the goal of finding tokens that can perform well in the medium to long term and have exceptional network activity and usage.

entry.title: The US SEC seeks to impose a $1.95 billion fine in the final judgment against Ripple.
entry.summary: According to BlockBeats news on March 27th, the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has requested a New York judge to impose a fine of $1.95 billion on Ripple Labs, according to court documents. On Monday, Ripple Labs' Chief Legal Officer Stuart Alderoty posted on social media that the SEC requested such a fine and that an edited version of the court documents would be made public on March 26th. The SEC's proposal calls for a court order requiring Ripple Labs to pay $876 million in illegal gains, $198 million in pre-judgment interest, and $876 million in civil penalties, for a total of $1.95 billion.

entry.title: Vitalik's article "Supporting Decentralized Staking with More Anti-Correlation Incentives"
entry.summary:
On March 27th, according to BlockBeats news, Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, suggested in Warpcast that "are validators within the same cluster (such as the same trading platform or user) more likely to miss proofs simultaneously than unrelated validators? If so, can we adjust rewards to support decentralized staking? It's possible."
In addition, Vitalik posted "Supporting Decentralized Staking Through More Anti-Correlation Incentives", stating that "a strategy for incentivizing better decentralization in protocols is to punish correlation. That is, if a participant makes a mistake (including accidental situations), the punishment they receive will increase with the number of other participants who make mistakes at the same time (measured in total ETH). This technology has been applied in Ethereum's penalty mechanism. However, edge cases that may never occur in practice may not be sufficiently incentivized to decentralize. This post proposes to extend similar anti-correlation incentives to more "ordinary" failure cases, such as missing a proof, which almost all validators will occasionally experience."

entry.title: The US CFTC reaffirmed that Ethereum is a commodity in its lawsuit against Kucoin.
entry.summary:
BlockBeats news reported on March 27th that the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) has once again affirmed that Ethereum and several other cryptocurrencies are commodities. The regulatory authorities are in a tug-of-war over the regulatory power of the massive digital asset industry.
On Tuesday, the derivatives regulator stated in a legal lawsuit against the operator of the cryptocurrency trading platform Kucoin that Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Litecoin are commodities, according to a press release. The CFTC's assertion marks the latest attempt by the regulatory agency to publicly attempt to classify native tokens of blockchain as commodities within its regulatory scope.
The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has yet to announce whether Ethereum is a security.

entry.title: Optimism will allocate over $3 billion in funding to support its blockchain builders.
entry.summary: According to BlockBeats news on March 27th, Ethereum Layer 2 scaling network Optimism will reserve $3.3 billion worth of Optimism (OP) tokens to award to projects or individuals who are deemed to have made significant contributions to the blockchain ecosystem. On March 26th, the governance and community department of the chain, Optimism Collective, announced that a portion of the 850 million OP tokens will be distributed in four rounds starting from May and continuing until the end of 2024. 40 million OP tokens worth approximately $158 million have already been distributed in the past three rounds. The blockchain developers will launch the fourth round of the Retrospective Public Goods Funding (RPGF) for Optimism, and the community will vote to decide which projects will receive the tokens based on the value they demonstrate. The fifth to seventh rounds will reward contributors to infrastructure, governance, and development tools, and anyone who contributes to improving Optimism is eligible for these funds. The final round will end in mid-November.

entry.title: KuCoin: All platform operations are normal, and user assets are absolutely safe.
entry.summary: BlockBeats reported on March 27th that KuCoin stated that all operations on the platform are normal and users' assets are absolutely safe. The platform has noticed relevant reports on the Internet and is investigating the situation with lawyers to understand the details. KuCoin complies with laws and regulations in various countries and strictly adheres to compliance standards.

entry.title: Analysis: Hong Kong may create a spot Bitcoin ETF in a manner contrary to that of the United States.
entry.summary:
According to a report from BlockBeats on March 26th, as reported by Cointelgraph, Bloomberg ETF analyst Rebecca Sin has released a new research report indicating that Hong Kong is expected to achieve the creation and redemption of physical Bitcoin ETFs in the second quarter of this year, which could be a significant market opportunity and could significantly increase the assets under management (AUM) and trading volume of Bitcoin ETF issuers in the region.
The report states that Hong Kong's goal is to create ETFs with physical Bitcoin, which is completely different from the United States, where only cash is allowed, meaning "cash in, Bitcoin ETF out". In Hong Kong, it is "Bitcoin in, ETF out".
